intro: Ormilis horminum, commonly known as the common mouse-ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces numerous stolons that help it spread across the ground. Ormilis horminum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
